alert.note: Alert for Broward (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 04 at 6:42PM EDT until June 04 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: The National Weather Service in Miami has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northern Broward County in southeastern Florida... * Until 815 PM EDT. * At 642 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rains training over the northeast Broward County producing rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches during the last hour on top of the already 6 and 10 inches of rain have fallen from last night heavy rains. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Fort Lauderdale, Coral Springs, Pompano Beach, Plantation, Sunrise, Deerfield Beach, Tamarac, Margate, Lighthouse Point, Lauderdale-By-The-Sea, Lauderhill, Coconut Creek, Oakland Park, North Lauderdale, Lauderdale Lakes, Parkland, Hillsboro Beach, Sea Ranch Lakes, Broadview-Pompano Park and Palm Aire. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report flooding to your local law enforcement agency when you can do so safely.
